00036   kernelMajor(std::ostream& o)
00037   {

00039     static version_type version;

00081   uvalue_caster<const char*>::operator() (UValue& v)

00084       return v.stringValue->c_str();

00100   static const char* formats[] = {
00101     "binary",
00102     "dictionary",
00103     "double",
00104     "list",
00105     "object",
00106     "string",
00107     "void"
00108   };

00110   const char*
00111   UValue::format_string() const
00112   {
00113     int f = static_cast<int>(type);
00114     if (f < 0 || f > DATA_VOID)
00115       return "unknown";
00116     return formats[f];
00117   }
00118 
00119 #define SKIP_SPACES()                           \
00120     while (message[pos] == ' ')                 \
00121       ++pos
00122 
00123   namespace
00124   {
00125     static
00126     bool
00127     strprefix(const char* prefix, const char* string)
00128     {
00129       return !strncmp(prefix, string, strlen(prefix));
00130     }
00131   }
00132 
00133 // Works on message[pos].
00134 #define EXPECT(Char)                                    \
00135   do {                                                  \
00136     if (message[pos] != Char)                           \
00137     {                                                   \
00138       GD_FERROR("unexpected `%s', expected `%s'",       \
00139                 message[pos], Char);                    \
00140       return -pos;                                      \
00141     }                                                   \
00142   } while(0)
00143 
00144 // Works on message[p] (not pos).
00145 #define CHECK_NEOF()                                            \
00146   do {                                                          \
00147     if (!message[p])                                            \
00148     {                                                           \
00149       GD_ERROR("unexpected end of file");                       \
00150       return -p;                                                \
00151     }                                                           \
00152   } while (0)
00153 
00154   int
00155   UValue::parse(const char* message, int pos,
00156                 const binaries_type& bins,
00157                 binaries_type::const_iterator& binpos)
00158   {
00159     SKIP_SPACES();
00160     if (message[pos] == '"')
00161     {
00162       //string
00163       type = DATA_STRING;
00164       //get terminating '"'
00165       int p = pos + 1;
00166       while (message[p] && message[p] != '"')
00167         p += 1 + (message[p] == '\\');
00168       CHECK_NEOF();
00169 
00170       stringValue = new std::string(
00171         libport::unescape(std::string(message + pos + 1, p - pos - 1)));
00172       return p + 1;
00173     }
00174 
00175     if (message[pos] == '[')
00176     {
00177       // List or Dictionary message.
00178       ++pos;
00179       bool hasElt = 0;
00180       while (message[pos])
00181       {
00182         SKIP_SPACES();
00183         if (!hasElt && !::strncmp(message + pos, "=>", 2))
00184         {
00185           // Detect empty dictionaries.
00186           type = DATA_DICTIONARY;
00187           dictionary = new UDictionary();
00188           pos += 2;
00189           SKIP_SPACES();
00190           continue;
00191         }
00192         if (message[pos] == ']')
00193         {
00194           // End of an empty list / dictionary (created above).
00195           if (type == DATA_VOID)
00196           {
00197             // End of an empty list, create it.
00198             type = DATA_LIST;
00199             list = new UList();
00200           }
00201           break;
00202         }
00203         UValue* v = new UValue();
00204         pos = v->parse(message, pos, bins, binpos);
00205         if (pos < 0)
00206         {
00207           delete v;
00208           return pos;
00209         }
00210         SKIP_SPACES();
00211         // Here is a dictionary key.
00212         if ((type == DATA_DICTIONARY || type == DATA_VOID)
00213             && !::strncmp(message + pos, "=>", 2) && v->type == DATA_STRING)
00214         {
00215           if (type == DATA_VOID)
00216           {
00217             type = DATA_DICTIONARY;
00218             dictionary = new UDictionary();
00219           }
00220 
00221           pos += 2;
00222           SKIP_SPACES();
00223           // Handle value associated with given key.
00224           std::string key = *(v->stringValue);
00225           (*dictionary)[key] = UValue();
00226           pos = (*dictionary)[key].parse(message, pos, bins, binpos);
00227           if (pos < 0)
00228           {
00229             delete v;
00230             return pos;
00231           }
00232         }
00233         else
00234         {
00235           if (type == DATA_VOID)
00236           {
00237             type = DATA_LIST;
00238             list = new UList();
00239           }
00240           list->array.push_back(v);
00241         }
00242         SKIP_SPACES();
00243         // Expect "," or "]".
00244         if (message[pos] == ']')
00245           break;
00246         EXPECT(',');
00247         hasElt = true;
00248         ++pos;
00249       }
00250 
00251       EXPECT(']');
00252       return pos + 1;
00253     }
00254 
00255     //OBJ a [x:12, y:4]
00256     if (strprefix("OBJ ", message + pos))
00257     {
00258       //obj message
00259       pos += 4;
00260       type = DATA_OBJECT;
00261       object = new UObjectStruct();
00262       SKIP_SPACES();
00263       EXPECT('[');
00264       ++pos;
00265 
00266       while (message[pos])
00267       {
00268         SKIP_SPACES();
00269         if (message[pos] == ']')
00270           break; //empty object
00271         //parse name
00272         int p = pos;
00273         while (message[p] && message[p] != ':')
00274           ++p;
00275         CHECK_NEOF();
00276         ++p;
00277         UNamedValue nv;
00278         nv.name = std::string(message + pos, p - pos - 1);
00279         pos = p;
00280         SKIP_SPACES();
00281         UValue* v = new UValue();
00282         p = v->parse(message, pos, bins, binpos);
00283         if (p < 0)
00284           return p;
00285         nv.val = v;
00286         object->array.push_back(nv);
00287         pos = p;
00288         SKIP_SPACES();
00289         //expect , or rbracket
00290         if (message[pos] == ']')
00291           break;
00292         EXPECT(',');
00293         ++pos;
00294       }
00295 
00296       EXPECT(']');
00297       return pos + 1;
00298     }
00299 
00300     if (strprefix("void", message+pos))
00301     {
00302       //void
00303       type = DATA_VOID;
00304       pos += 4;
00305       return pos;
00306     }
00307 
00308     if (strprefix("BIN ", message + pos))
00309     {
00310       //binary message: delegate
00311       type = DATA_BINARY;
00312       binary = new UBinary();
00313       pos += 4;
00314       //parsing type
00315       return binary->parse(message, pos, bins, binpos);
00316     }
00317 
00318     // true and false used by k2
00319     if (strprefix("true", message + pos))
00320     {
00321       type = DATA_DOUBLE;
00322       val = 1;
00323       return pos+4;
00324     }
00325 
00326     if (strprefix("false", message + pos))
00327     {
00328       type = DATA_DOUBLE;
00329       val = 0;
00330       return pos+5;
00331     }
00332 
00333     // Last attempt: it should be a double.
00334     {
00335       int p;
00336       if (sscanf(message+pos, "%lf%n", &val, &p))
00337       {
00338         type = DATA_DOUBLE;
00339         pos += p;
00340         return pos;
00341       }
00342     }
00343 
00344     // Anything else is an error, but be resilient and ignore it.
00345     GD_FWARN("syntax error: %s (ignored)",
00346                 std::string(message + pos));
00347     return -pos;
00348   }
00349 
00350   std::ostream&
00351   UValue::print(std::ostream& s) const
00352   {
00353     switch (type)
00354     {
00355       case DATA_DOUBLE:
00356         s << std::setprecision(21) <<  static_cast<ufloat>(val);
00357         break;
00358       case DATA_STRING:
00359         s << '"' << libport::escape(*stringValue, '"') << '"';
00360         break;
00361       case DATA_SLOTNAME:
00362         s << *stringValue;
00363         break;
00364       case DATA_BINARY:
00365         s << *binary;
00366         break;
00367       case DATA_LIST:
00368         s << *list;
00369         break;
00370       case DATA_DICTIONARY:
00371         s << *dictionary;
00372         break;
00373       case DATA_OBJECT:
00374         s << *object;
00375         break;
00376       case DATA_VOID:
00377         break;
00378     }
00379     return s;
00380   }

00393   // All the following mess could be avoid if we used templates...

00396 #define UVALUE_OPERATORS(Args, DataType, Field, Value)  \
00397   UValue::UValue(Args, bool copy)                       \
00398     : type(DataType)                                    \
00399     , Field(Value)                                      \
00400   {                                                     \
00401     (void) copy;                                        \
00402   }                                                     \
00403                                                         \
00404   UValue& UValue::operator=(Args)                       \
00405   {                                                     \
00406     clear();                                            \
00407     type = DataType;                                    \
00408     Field = Value;                                      \
00409     return *this;                                       \
00410   }
00411 
00412 #define UVALUE_DOUBLE(Type)                     \
00413   UVALUE_OPERATORS(Type v, DATA_DOUBLE, val, v)
00414 
00415   UVALUE_DOUBLE(ufloat)
00416   UVALUE_DOUBLE(int)
00417   UVALUE_DOUBLE(unsigned int)
00418   UVALUE_DOUBLE(long)
00419   UVALUE_DOUBLE(unsigned long)
00420   UVALUE_DOUBLE(long long)
00421   UVALUE_DOUBLE(unsigned long long)
00422 
00423 #undef UVALUE_DOUBLE

00433   ptr_string (const void* v)

00471   void
00472   UValue::clear()
00473   {
00474     switch(type)
00475     {
00476       case DATA_STRING:
00477       case DATA_SLOTNAME:
00478         delete stringValue;
00479         break;
00480       case DATA_BINARY:
00481         delete binary;
00482         break;
00483       case DATA_LIST:
00484         delete list;
00485         break;
00486       case DATA_DICTIONARY:
00487         delete dictionary;
00488         break;
00489       case DATA_OBJECT:
00490         delete object;
00491         break;
00492       case DATA_DOUBLE:
00493       case DATA_VOID:
00494         break;
00495     }
00496     type = DATA_VOID;
00497   }
00498 
00499   UValue::~UValue()
00500   {
00501     clear();
00502   }
00503 
00504   UValue::operator ufloat() const
00505   {
00506     switch (type)
00507     {
00508       case DATA_DOUBLE:
00509         return val;
00510       case DATA_STRING:
00511         return lexical_cast<ufloat>(*stringValue);
00512       case DATA_BINARY:
00513       case DATA_LIST:
00514       case DATA_DICTIONARY:
00515       case DATA_OBJECT:
00516       case DATA_VOID:
00517       case DATA_SLOTNAME:
00518         break;
00519     }
00520     return ufloat(0);
00521   }
00522 
00523 
00524   UValue::operator std::string() const
00525   {
00526     switch (type)
00527     {
00528       case DATA_DOUBLE:
00529         return string_cast(val);
00530       case DATA_STRING:
00531       case DATA_SLOTNAME:
00532         return *stringValue;
00533       // We cannot convert to UBinary because it is ambigous so we
00534       // try until we found the right type.
00535       case DATA_BINARY:
00536       {
00537         USound snd(*this);
00538         if (snd.soundFormat != SOUND_UNKNOWN)
00539           return string_cast(snd);
00540         break;
00541       }
00542       default:
00543         break;
00544     }
00545     return "invalid";
00546   }
00547 
00548   UValue::operator const UBinary&() const
00549   {
00550     static UBinary dummy;
00551     if (type != DATA_BINARY)
00552       return dummy;
00553     else
00554       return *binary;
00555   }

00557   UValue::operator UImage() const
00558   {
00559     if (type == DATA_BINARY && binary->type == BINARY_IMAGE)
00560       return binary->image;
00561     return UImage::make();
00562   }

00564   UValue::operator USound() const
00565   {
00566     if (type == DATA_BINARY && binary->type == BINARY_SOUND)
00567       return binary->sound;
00568     return USound::make();
00569   }

00571   UValue::operator UList() const
00572   {
00573     if (type == DATA_LIST)
00574       return UList(*list);
00575     return UList();

00585   UValue& UValue::operator= (const UValue& v)
00586   {
00587     return set(v);
00588   }
00589 
00590   UValue& UValue::set(const UValue& v, bool copy)
00591   {
00592     // TODO: optimize
00593     if (this == &v)
00594       return *this;
00595     clear();
00596 
00597     type = v.type;
00598     switch (type)
00599     {
00600       case DATA_DOUBLE:
00601         val = v.val;
00602         break;
00603       case DATA_STRING:
00604       case DATA_SLOTNAME:
00605         stringValue = new std::string(*v.stringValue);
00606         break;
00607       case DATA_BINARY:
00608         binary = new UBinary(*v.binary, copy);
00609         break;
00610       case DATA_LIST:
00611         list = new UList(*v.list);
00612         break;
00613       case DATA_DICTIONARY:
00614         dictionary = new UDictionary(*v.dictionary);
00615         break;
00616       case DATA_OBJECT:
00617         object = new UObjectStruct(*v.object);
00618         break;
00619       case DATA_VOID:
00620         storage = v.storage;
00621         break;
00622     }
00623     return *this;
00624   }

00646   UList& UList::operator= (const UList& b)
00647   {
00648     if (this == &b)
00649       return *this;
00650     clear();
00651     foreach (UValue* v, b.array)
00652       array.push_back(new UValue(*v));
00653     offset = b.offset;
00654     return *this;
00655   }
00656 
00657   UList::~UList()
00658   {
00659     clear();
00660   }
00661 
00662   void UList::clear()
00663   {
00664     offset = 0;
00665     foreach (UValue *v, array)
00666       delete v;
00667     array.clear();
00668   }

00670   std::ostream&
00671   UList::print(std::ostream& o) const
00672   {
00673     o << '[';
00674     size_t sz = size();
00675     for (unsigned i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
00676       o << (*this)[i]
00677         << (i != sz - 1 ? ", " : "");
00678     o << ']';
00679     return o;
00680   }

00687 
00688   std::ostream&
00689   operator<<(std::ostream& s, const urbi::UDictionary& d)
00690   {
00691     s << "[";
00692     if (d.empty())
00693       s << "=>";
00694     else
00695     {
00696       bool isFirst = true;
00697       foreach (const UDictionary::value_type& t, d)
00698       {
00699         if (!isFirst)
00700           s << ",";
00701         s << "\"" << libport::escape(t.first) << "\"=>";
00702         t.second.print(s);
00703         isFirst = false;
00704       }
00705     }
00706     return s << "]";
00707   }

00720   UObjectStruct::~UObjectStruct()
00721   {
00722     // Relax, it's a vector.
00723     for (size_t i = 0; i < size(); ++i)
00724       delete array[i].val;
00725     array.clear();
00726   }
00727 
00728   UObjectStruct&
00729   UObjectStruct::operator= (const UObjectStruct& b)
00730   {
00731     if (this == &b)
00732       return *this;
00733 
00734     // Relax, it's a vector.
00735     this->~UObjectStruct();
00736 
00737     for (std::vector<UNamedValue>::const_iterator it = b.array.begin();
00738          it != b.array.end();
00739          ++it)
00740       array.push_back(UNamedValue(it->name, new UValue(*(it->val))));
00741 
00742     return *this;
00743   }
00744 
00745   UValue&
00746   UObjectStruct::operator[] (const std::string& s)
00747   {
00748     for (size_t i = 0; i < size(); ++i)
00749       if (array[i].name == s)
00750         return *array[i].val;
00751     return UValue::error();
00752   }

00755   std::ostream&
00756   UObjectStruct::print(std::ostream& o) const
00757   {
00758     o << "OBJ " << refName << " [";
00759     size_t sz = size();
00760     for (size_t i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
00761       o << (*this)[i].name << ':' << (*this)[i].val
00762         << (i != sz - 1 ? ", " : "");
00763     return o << ']';
00764   }
